note.p: Education: King's College School, London; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1868), MA

Career: Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge; Honorary Fellow of King's College, London; Chief Assistant, Royal Observatory, Greenwich (1870); Editor, 'The Observatory,' a monthly review of Astronomy; Astronomer Royal (1881); went on astronomical expeditions to Japan (1896), India (1898), Portugal (1900) and Tunis (1905); retired (1910)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1922-1923 vol 102 pp xi-xvi signed by F W D
